My son<S>1121</S>, if thou wilt receive<S>3947</S> my words<S>561</S>, and hide<S>6845</S> my commandments<S>4687</S> with thee;
So that thou incline<S>7181</S> thine ear<S>241</S> unto wisdom<S>2451</S>, and apply<S>5186</S> thine heart<S>3820</S> to understanding<S>8394</S>;
Yea, if thou criest<S>7121</S> after knowledge<S>998</S>, and liftest up<S>5414</S> thy voice<S>6963</S> for understanding<S>8394</S>; <sup>liftest: Heb. givest thy voice</sup>
If thou seekest<S>1245</S> her as silver<S>3701</S>, and searchest<S>2664</S> for her as for hid treasures<S>4301</S>;
Then shalt thou understand<S>995</S> the fear<S>3374</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>, and find<S>4672</S> the knowledge<S>1847</S> of God<S>430</S>.
For the LORD<S>3068</S> giveth<S>5414</S> wisdom<S>2451</S>: out of his mouth<S>6310</S> cometh knowledge<S>1847</S> and understanding<S>8394</S>.
He layeth up<S>6845</S> <S>6845</S> sound wisdom<S>8454</S> for the righteous<S>3477</S>: he is a buckler<S>4043</S> to them that walk<S>1980</S> uprightly<S>8537</S>.
He keepeth<S>5341</S> the paths<S>734</S> of judgment<S>4941</S>, and preserveth<S>8104</S> the way<S>1870</S> of his saints<S>2623</S>.
Then shalt thou understand<S>995</S> righteousness<S>6664</S>, and judgment<S>4941</S>, and equity<S>4339</S>; yea, every good<S>2896</S> path<S>4570</S>.
When wisdom<S>2451</S> entereth<S>935</S> into thine heart<S>3820</S>, and knowledge<S>1847</S> is pleasant<S>5276</S> unto thy soul<S>5315</S>;
Discretion<S>4209</S> shall preserve<S>8104</S> thee, understanding<S>8394</S> shall keep<S>5341</S> thee:
To deliver<S>5337</S> thee from the way<S>1870</S> of the evil<S>7451</S> man, from the man<S>376</S> that speaketh<S>1696</S> froward things<S>8419</S>;
Who leave<S>5800</S> the paths<S>734</S> of uprightness<S>3476</S>, to walk<S>3212</S> in the ways<S>1870</S> of darkness<S>2822</S>;
Who rejoice<S>8056</S> to do<S>6213</S> evil<S>7451</S>, and delight<S>1523</S> in the frowardness<S>8419</S> of the wicked<S>7451</S>;
Whose ways<S>734</S> are crooked<S>6141</S>, and they froward<S>3868</S> in their paths<S>4570</S>:
To deliver<S>5337</S> thee from the strange<S>2114</S> woman<S>802</S>, even from the stranger<S>5237</S> which flattereth<S>2505</S> with her words<S>561</S>;
Which forsaketh<S>5800</S> the guide<S>441</S> of her youth<S>5271</S>, and forgetteth<S>7911</S> the covenant<S>1285</S> of her God<S>430</S>.
For her house<S>1004</S> inclineth<S>7743</S> unto death<S>4194</S>, and her paths<S>4570</S> unto the dead<S>7496</S>.
None that go<S>935</S> unto her return again<S>7725</S>, neither take they hold<S>5381</S> of the paths<S>734</S> of life<S>2416</S>.
That thou mayest walk<S>3212</S> in the way<S>1870</S> of good<S>2896</S> men, and keep<S>8104</S> the paths<S>734</S> of the righteous<S>6662</S>.
For the upright<S>3477</S> shall dwell<S>7931</S> in the land<S>776</S>, and the perfect<S>8549</S> shall remain<S>3498</S> in it.
But the wicked<S>7563</S> shall be cut off<S>3772</S> from the earth<S>776</S>, and the transgressors<S>898</S> shall be rooted out<S>5255</S> of it. <sup>rooted: or, plucked up</sup>
